trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon a SAML assertion.
The claims for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are expressed as part of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>.

A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> has an extensible set of claims known as SAML statements that are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements%2A> property.
The SAML authority that issued the SAML assertion is specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified SAML assertion.
This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Initialize%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> method, which can be overridden in derived classes.
For <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens, the claims are specified using a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the SAML assertion for this security token.
Gets the SAML assertion for this security token.
For <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens, the claims are specified using a SAML assertion.

Use a constructor or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Initialize%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> method to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Assertion%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the SAML assertion for this security token.
Gets a value indicating whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier.
To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
`true` when T is of type ; otherwise, `false`.
Creates the specified key identifier clause.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier.
To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertionKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that is a key identifier clause for a SAML security token.
T is not of type .
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token is serialized into XML, the value of the Id attribute is set to the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
The unique identifier of the security token.
Initializes the properties of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified SAML assertion.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.%23ctor%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Initialize%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> method, which can be overridden in derived classes.
For <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens, the claims are specified using a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the SAML assertion for this security token.
assertion is `null`.
Returns a value indicating whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.
`true` if skiClause is a and it has the same unique identifier as the property; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property to set the cryptographic keys for this security token to protect a SOAP message.
The keys can be used, among other things, to digitally sign or encrypt SOAP messages.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
By default, a 5-minute clock skew is allowed between the sender and receiver of the security token.

So, if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property is set to 1:00 PM, then the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to 12:55 PM.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to <xref:System.DateTime.MinValue>, then the SAML assertion associated with this <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token does not have any conditions set.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
By default, a 5-minute clock skew is allowed between the sender and receiver of the security token.

So, if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> property is set to 1:00 PM, then the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to 1:05 PM.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> property is set to <xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue>, then the SAML assertion associated with this <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token does not have any conditions set.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
